newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil ends lower but sentiment still bullish.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil ends lower but sentiment still bullish.

text.p: IPE Oct gas oil closed softer on Friday but off the session low as persistent bullish sentiment curbed profit-taking, brokers said.
"There's been some selling on Oct, but Nov finished strong which shows the fundamentals of this market are still good," said one IPE floor broker.
Oct gas oil closed $1.25 down at $245.50 a tonne, while the Nov contract climbed $1 to close just off the session high at $235.50.
The front-month backwardation narrowed by $2.25 to $10 a tonne, having dipped below $9 earlier.
Some traders said they were selling Oct gas oil ahead of the expiry of the contract next Thursday.
IPE Nov Brent rebounded shortly after the gas oil close as a rally in NYMEX heating oil led the market up.
"Heating oil is picking up again, they're expecting some cold wether over there this weekend," a broker said.
Nov Brent was trading at $23.75 a barrel by 1655 GMT, one cent up on the day and off an intra-day low of $23.48.
